summary: This bill, "Commission To Study the Potential of a National Museum of Italian American History and Culture Act," proposes the establishment of a commission to investigate the feasibility of creating a national museum dedicated to Italian American history and culture. The commission will be composed of eight members appointed by congressional leaders.  Its duties include developing a plan of action, reporting on various issues related to the museum (including cost, location, and governance), and creating a fundraising plan. The commission is responsible and will not rely on federal funding.
